meanings.sent1: The ancient stories tell of gods divinising mortal heroes for their bravery.

meanings.definition: To elevate to the status of a god
meanings.sent1: The legendary warrior was divinised in tales as a deity of war and courage.
meanings.sent2: The pharaoh sought to divinise himself, claiming a divine right to rule.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that his cat divinised him, expecting to be worshipped with treats.
meanings.sent4: The city lights at night divinised the skyline, turning it into a celestial spectacle.
meanings.sent5: The music had a transcendent quality, divinising the ordinary moment into something extraordinary.
